FuncDef:
The rip max-packet-length command sets the maximum length of RIP packets.
The undo rip max-packet-length command restores the default length. The rip max-packet-length command sets the maximum length of RIP packets. The undo rip max-packet-length command restores the default length. By default, the maximum length of RIP packets is 512 bytes.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the maximum length of a RIP packet.
The value is an integer ranging from 32 to 65535, in bytes.

Indicates that the maximum length of a RIP packet is determined by the interface Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU).
-

ExtraInfo: To set the maximum length of RIP packets, run the rip max-packet-length command, which improves link bandwidth utilization.
